question.text: What is not correct about mitosis?

options.text: Usually restricted to the diploid cells and haploid cells of some social insects
Furrow extends centripetally and microfilament ring brings about cleavage in plant cells.
Growth in multicellular organisms is a result of Mitosis

solution.text: Mitosis is an equational division in which one cell divides to form <math><mn>2</mn></math> daughter cells having the same number of chromosomes. It is quantitatively and qualitatively equational division. In animal cells, the cleavage furrow extends centripetally and the microfilament ring is involved in this process. In plant cells, the cell plate grows centrifugally without involving microfilaments.
